page.title: 07SOUTH-AYR MUSEUMS/GALLERIES
page.content: {BURNS' COTTAGE AND MUSEUM The white-washed, thatched cottage is the birth-place of Burns and within it the cupboard bed and the bed in which he was born arouse much curiosity. The museum contains the greatly prized Burns' family bible and the first issue of the Kilmarnock edition of poems is on display. A mural portraying the life of Burns is currently being finalised. {MACLAURIN ART GALLERY { }Located in Rozelle Park, it has four galleries in which a variety of exhibits, ranging from sculpture to photography, is shown and is regularly changed. {ROZELLE HOUSE As well as works of art, one can view the Provost's regalia, medals and different military uniforms.
